title: Exam-01
text:
Question 1
First, we read the data and take a look at how does it look.


Code
world = read_csv("data/world-3.csv")

world |> 
  sample_n(10) |> 
  arrange(country) |> 
  gt() |> 
  fmt_number(
    columns = c(6, 10, 11, 12),
    decimals = 2
  )

Then, we make a description of all the numeric values.


Code
world |> 
  select(where(is.numeric)) |> 
  skim() |> 
  select(-1) |> 
  gt() |> 
  fmt_number(
    columns = 3:10,
    decimals = 2
  ) |> 
  cols_label(
    skim_variable = "variable",
    n_missing = "missing",
    numeric.mean = "mean",
    numeric.sd = "std",
    numeric.p0 = "p0",
    numeric.p25 = "p25",
    numeric.p50 = "p50",
    numeric.p75 = "p75",
    numeric.p100 = "p100",
    numeric.hist = "histogram"
  ) |> 
  cols_align(
    columns = -1,
    align = "center"
  )

We see from Table 2 that some of the variables have missing data, specifically, the literacym variable has complete rate of 78%. Also, the standard deviation from each variable is in a different scale, ranging from 0.62 units in gdp to 38.08 in babymort. This makes sense because some variables are in a log-scale.
